title: Ticket #675: Support for GRAM5 in Condor-G
description:
Globus GRAM5 is in development. It's a modification of GRAM2 and attempts to address most of the deficiencies of GRAM2. It's meant to interoperate with GRAM2 clients, but some changes need to be made in Condor-G to work well with it.

  • Condor-G should automatically detect whether a server is GRAM2 or GRAM5.
  • User can give a hint to Condor-G whether a server is GRAM2 or GRAM5.
  • Grid monitor should be disabled for GRAM5 servers.
  • Jobmanager limit shouldn't apply to GRAM5 servers.
  • Jobmanagers on GRAM5 servers shouldn't be stopped or restarted.
remarks:
2009-Aug-19 16:14:05 by jfrey:
Just pushed code for 7.3.2 to do everything outlined in this ticket other than automatically detecting whether a server is GRAM2 or GRAM5. Currently, we rely on the user to tell us by using 'gt2' or 'gt5' in the GridResource job attribute.

The Globus team plans to add something to the GRAM API to allow clients to query to the version of the server. Once that's in place, the gridmanager can automatically distinguish between GRAM2 and GRAM5.
